test-set.name: fn-generate-id
test-set.description: Tests for the generate-id() function transferred from the XSLT 2.0 specification to XPath/XQuery 3.0

source.description: Data for various NIST tests (abbreviated, unabbreviated syntax)
Data for the the XML Query NS use cases

test-case.name: generate-id-000
test-case.description: generate-id() applied to an empty sequence

test-case.name: generate-id-001
test-case.description: generate-id() applied to an element node

test-case.name: generate-id-002
test-case.description: generate-id() applied to an attribute node

test-case.name: generate-id-003
test-case.description: generate-id() applied to a document node

test-case.name: generate-id-004
test-case.description: generate-id() applied to a comment node

test-case.name: generate-id-005
test-case.description: generate-id() applied to a processing instruction node

test-case.name: generate-id-006
test-case.description: generate-id() applied to a text node

test-case.name: generate-id-007
test-case.description: generate-id() applied to a namespace node (if supported)

test-case.name: generate-id-008
test-case.description: generate-id() with no arguments applied to a document node

test-case.name: generate-id-009
test-case.description: generate-id() with no arguments applied to an element node

test-case.name: generate-id-010
test-case.description: Uniqueness of generated IDs

test-case.name: generate-id-011
test-case.description: Uniqueness of generated IDs including namespaces

test-case.name: generate-id-012
test-case.description: Uniqueness of generated IDs for document nodes across multiple documents

modified.change: Added feature dependency - Fix to bug issue #22423

test-case.name: generate-id-013
test-case.description: Uniqueness of generated IDs for element nodes across multiple documents

modified.change: Added feature dependency - Fix to bug issue #22423

test-case.name: generate-id-014
test-case.description: generate-id() applied to a parentless element node

modified.change: remove dependency on special fots:copy() function

test-case.name: generate-id-015
test-case.description: generate-id() applied to a parentless attribute node

modified.change: remove dependency on special fots:copy() function

test-case.name: generate-id-016
test-case.description: generate-id() changes when a node is copied

modified.change: remove dependency on special fots:copy() function

test-case.test: import module namespace copy="http://www.w3.org/QT3/copy"; generate-id(copy:copy(/*)) eq generate-id(/*)

test-case.name: generate-id-017
test-case.description: generate-id() applied to a parentless attribute node

modified.change: remove dependency on special fots:copy() function

test-case.test: import module namespace copy="http://www.w3.org/QT3/copy"; let $att := (//@*)[1] return generate-id(copy:copy($att)) eq generate-id($att)

test-case.name: generate-id-018
test-case.description: generate-id() applied to a sequence of element nodes in backwards-compatibility mode

test-case.name: generate-id-019
test-case.description: All generated IDs are ASCII alphanumeric
test-case.test: let $nodes := (/ | //*/(.|@*|comment()|processing-instruction()|text())) return every $id in $nodes/generate-id() satisfies matches($id, '^[A-Za-z][A-Za-z0-9]*$')

test-case.name: generate-id-020
test-case.description: generate-id() applied to constructed nodes

test-case.name: generate-id-021
test-case.description: generate-id() applied to constructed nodes

test-case.name: generate-id-022
test-case.description: generate-id() applied to constructed nodes

test-case.name: generate-id-023
test-case.description: generate-id() applied to constructed nodes

test-case.name: generate-id-901
test-case.description: generate-id() with no context item

test-case.name: generate-id-902
test-case.description: generate-id() with context item not a node

test-case.name: generate-id-903
test-case.description: generate-id() with context item not a node

test-case.name: generate-id-904
test-case.description: generate-id() with context item not a node
test-case.test: let $f := function($x as item()) {""} return generate-id($f)

test-case.name: generate-id-905
test-case.description: generate-id() applied to a sequence of nodes
